direction.raw_text: Jesus, Judy, she's pregnant.   Turn your hearing aide up. Zoe closes her eyes.    Nightmare. INT. NANA'S ROOM - LATER Nana hands Zoe a cup of tea.   Zoe's eyes well with tears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What am I going to do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm confused. Isn't this what you wanted? You bought sperm and were inseminated by your doctor. This isn't what we would call an accident.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But now it's all happening so fast. Did I really think this through?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We talked about it for months. You said it was what you wanted more than anything in the world.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But this guy, he's...special.   It's all going to fall apart now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What makes him so special?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. He's very...real. And funny. And different. The other guys I've been with all had their briefcases and their five- year plans and their secretaries they were fucking. Stan doesn't have a five-year plan. I don't even know if he has a plan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about a secretary?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Some kid named Fred. (then) I like him, Nana.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, if he's the right one, he'll stay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you really think so?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gosh, I don't know. I hoped that would be enough to appease you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Should I still visit him for the weekend? Or should I just vanish and hope he forgets I ever existed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't be silly. Go up there for the weekend. Spend some time with him and see what he's really like.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.   You're right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You might find out he's a total douchebag and then the whole thing is moot. Zoe looks at Nana.   Douchebag? INT. CAR - DAY Zoe is in the car. We are CLOSE on her as she talks rapidly and a bit maniacally.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, so we'll just hope that he's a douchebag. Could happen, right? WIDEN to reveal Nuts in the passenger seat.      He's yawning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry.     Am I keeping you up? Nuts closes his eyes and lays down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My whole life is falling apart and you can't keep your bug-eyes open? (yawning) Thanks. Now I'm yawning. But why am I so tired? I slept nine hours. (thinks, then) And I'm starving, too. What the hell is going on? Zoe sees a gas station and jams on the breaks. INT. GAS STATION MINI MART - DAY Zoe pours a massive cup of coffee. One of those gas station Big Gulp cups. Even the TRUCKER next to her chooses a smaller cup. Then, a look crosses her face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Am I even allowed to drink coffee? The trucker looks at her.    She looks at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you know anything about being pregnant?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. CAR - LATER Zoe's car is now parked on the side of a highway in the middle of nowhere. INT. CAR - SAME Zoe is sound asleep with her head back and her mouth open. A small, empty coffee cup in her hand, crumpled candy bar wrappers on the floor, and an almost empty bag of Cheetos is in her lap. Her cell phone RINGS. Zoe doesn't move. After the third ring, she lifts her head and looks around. It takes her a few moments to realize what's happened. She looks at the little coffee cup.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks a lot, decaf. She picks up the phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where are you? Zoe looks around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have no idea. EXT. LITTLE GOAT FARM - DAY Zoe bumps along the winding driveway of this idyllic Hudson River farm. There are red barns in the distance and green pastures filled with goats and sheep. The house is an old carriage house with a rusty weather-vane on top. Zoe parks the car and takes in the whole scene. Stan opens the front door, with a huge smile on his face. Zoe sighs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's so not a douchebag. INT. HOUSE - MOMENTS LATER They enter the front door.    Zoe takes in the charming carriage house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't believe you live here. This is ridiculous.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I just come on weekends. My parents really live here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh.   Where are they now?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the kitchen. Zoe stops short.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait, they're here? Now? Is this a "meet the parents" kind of thing? I wasn't prepared for this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. Not at all.    I mean, you'll meet them, but--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When you said come up for the weekend, I assumed it was just us. (then) I think I need to lay down. INT. STAN'S BEDROM - MOMENTS LATER Zoe lies in the small bed with the covers pulled up to her chin. Stan stands above her with an odd look on his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you hung-over or something?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm just...not myself. Give me ten minutes. A ten-minute power nap and I'm good. I need to regroup.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you sure you're okay? (then) Zoe? Hello? But she's already out.   Stan gives her a little poke. INT. KITCHEN - DAY Stan enters the kitchen. His parents, JOAN and EDWARD look up expectantly, as if about to meet their new daughter-in- law.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh.   It's just you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's taking a nap.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A nap?   Now? She just got here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mom, I need you to not be judgemental, okay. I like this girl a lot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How can I be judgemental?    We haven't even met her yet. We hear a SQUEAK, SQUEAK, SQUEAK coming down the hall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the heck is that? The SQUEAKING continues and then all eyes turn as Nuts rolls into the kitchen and stops. He tilts his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh.   This is Nuts. Joan and Edward take in the raggedy/wheelchair-bound dog and then look at Stan. Stan shoots his mom a look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who's judging?! INT. STAN'S BEDROOM - LATER It's now dark. Zoe is asleep in the exact same position. Suddenly, we hear a loud GRUMBLE. Her eyes open.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What was that? We hear the GRUMBLE again.    It's her stomach.   She puts her hands over it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whoa. Zoe gets out of bed and goes right for the Cheetos. The bag is empty. She smears her hand on the inside of the bag and then licks the orange cheese from her fingers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. HALLWAY - MOMENTS LATER Zoe peeks out of the bedroom and looks both ways.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (whispering) Stan? No one in sight.   She waits a beat and then whispers louder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stan! INT. KITCHEN - NIGHT Zoe peers her head into the empty kitchen.   Nuts is with her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stan?    Hello? Zoe stands there unsure of what to do next. Then we hear her stomach GROWL again. Her eyes turn to the stove. Something smells out of this world. She tiptoes over and opens the pot. It's beef stew.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, my God. She makes sure the coast is clear and then looks for a spoon. She can't find one. She spies a loaf of white bread. Grabs a piece, folds it and then scoops up a heaping bite of stew and devours it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (mouth full) Oh, my God. She replaces the lid on the pot. And now she just stands there. And stands there some more.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, who am I kidding? She quickly takes two slices of bread and goes back in. This time, she uses one piece of bread as a ladle and then the other to turn it into a sandwich. She takes a huge bite.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh.   My.    God. Stew dribbles down her chin. She takes a third piece of bread to wipe her face and then takes a bite of that one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Nuts starts to whine and beg. Zoe uses her bread-ladle to toss some stew on the floor for him. It lands with plop. And now Joan enters. Zoe and Nuts turn, their mouths bursting. Joan doesn't quite know what to do. All she knows is she's supposed to be open-minded.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would you like a plate? Zoe shakes her head no.     Wow.   This is embarrassing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A napkin? Zoe nods her head. Joan gives her one. Zoe holds it over her mouth as she tries in vain to swallow this inhuman bite.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm Joan. Zoe nods.   Still can't swallow the bite.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And you must be Zoe. Zoe nods again. She tries to shake Joan's hand. It's the best she can do. Unfortunately, her fingers are fluorescent orange from the Cheetos powder. Joan pulls her hand back. INT. DINING ROOM - LATER The dining room is warm and lovely. There's faded wallpaper and an old stagecoach lamp serving as a chandelier. Despite the inviting room, Zoe looks very uncomfortable.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The stew is delicious, honey.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, Mom, it's awesome.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Zoe) Have you ever in your life had stew like this? Come on, be honest. Zoe looks at Joan.      Joan smiles.    It will be their secret.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh...no.    Never.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. LIVING ROOM - LATER They are having coffee and dessert in the living room. Things seem more comfortable now. Zoe actually looks like she might be enjoying herself. Nuts sits beside her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So are all the animals in your pet store...differently abled?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, you can say paralyzed. He doesn't mind. (then) No, our pets are all in great shape. Purebreads mostly, but not from puppy mills.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Those puppy mills are terrible.    I read about them in the paper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, that's actually how I ended up with Nuts. I bought him from this pet store near my house. Six months later, I had thousands of dollars in vet bills and had to put him in a wheelchair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You should have sued that place.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought about it, but what was that really going to do? They were still going to sell inbred dogs. So...I took the money I made when I left Google and just bought the place figuring I would do better.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You worked for Google? Zoe nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How could I not know that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You never asked.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And you made a lot of money and then bought a pet store? Stan puts his arm around her and gives her a squeeze.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I love that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's been fun. Beats brand management, that's for sure.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Edward) That sounds like us, honey.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's true. (to Zoe) When we bought this farm we just wanted to make cheese because we couldn't find anything we liked in the stores. And now, twenty years later, here we are...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sometimes in life you just have to take matters into your own hands. Make things happen your own way, you know? Zoe forces a smile.   If only they knew. EXT. LITTLE GOAT FARM - NIGHT The moon is full and fireflies dot the air as Zoe and Stan walk the grounds of the farm. Nuts trots/rolls ahead of them in a different wheelchair. This one is more rugged, with mountain-bike-type wheels.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't believe that Nuts has an off-road wheelchair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's got one for snow, too.      With little skis on the bottom. Stan smiles and shakes his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're really something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you making fun of me?   Do you think I spoil him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I really think you're amazing. I mean, that story you told tonight. You just quit your whole professional life because of this little dog? Started your own business, just like that? Zoe shrugs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're very...unique.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, you're a dime a dozen. I can't tell you how many banjo playing, cheese makers I've been with.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I keep waiting for the other shoe to drop. Like, how can you be so perfect? Why are you even still single? I can't believe no one's snatched you up by now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I drive them all away, I guess.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, right. Stan takes her in his arms.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, I know this is all going fast...the time we're spending together, meeting my parents and everything...but, I'm okay with that. I want it to go fast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It is going fast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But isn't that okay? Aren't we old enough to skip all the bullshit? What are we waiting for? I...want to be with you. Zoe opens her mouth. She's got to tell him.    Before this goes any further, she has to tell him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on. There's something I want to show you. INT. CHEESE CAVE - NIGHT It's floor to ceiling wooden shelves all filled with cheese. Stan ceremoniously unwraps a wheel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's cheese.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can see that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a new kind of goat's milk we're using. I've been developing the recipe, and now it needs to age. It'll be ready for market in several months. (then, excited) Want to know what it's called?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Zoe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You named a piece of cheese after me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not just one piece. The whole line. This will forever in history be known as the Zoe. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Unless, of course, it tastes like shit, and then we'll just scrap it. (with a wink) But that'll never happen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How do you know?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because it's going to be fantastic. Sweet and sassy and very complex. Why do you think I'm calling it Zoe?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No one's ever named a piece of cheese after me before. Zoe stares at the cheese for a long time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're kind of hard to read right now. You're either seriously flattered or totally repulsed. Zoe smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want to kiss you right now, but it really smells like cheese in here. EXT. DAIRY - MOMENTS LATER The door to the dairy kicks open and Stan carries Zoe out. Her legs are around his waist and they are making out like crazy. INT. HOUSE - MOMENTS LATER Stan carries Zoe up the stairs. They are tripping and kissing and now tearing at each other's clothes. INT. STAN'S BEDROOM - NIGHT Stan throws Zoe on the bed and then peels off his shirt. His body looks amazing in the shadowy moonlight. Zoe lies there, looking at him before he jumps on top of her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (under her breath) You're such a douchebag.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? Zoe shakes her head and then melts into him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That was amazing. I mean, like, totally and exceptionally, over-the- top, amazing. Zoe turns to him.   Takes a deep breath.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's something I really have to tell you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's something I have to tell you, too. Now Stan turns to her.     They are face-to-face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can I go first? `Cause if we're going to say the same thing, I want to say it first.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're not going to say the same thing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, let me go, because this is really embarrassing, and I just have to say it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've dated a lot of women. I mean, not tons, but a lot. And, the thing is, I've never...been in love before. I've never even told anyone I love them before. Because I just never felt it. But from the day we met, from the first time our backs accidentally touched in the subway, I feel this, this... (he shakes his head) Maybe this is too much to say right now, but...I love you, Zoe. I really do. Stan finishes.    He looks at her and smiles.   Zoe just stares at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In my mind, you were supposed to say, I love you, too. Instead, Zoe covers her mouth and runs to the bathroom.     A beat later, we hear her vomit. INT. STAN'S BATHROOM - MOMENTS LATER Zoe is at the sink, furiously brushing her teeth.    Stan enters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Zoe? He looks at her.   Sees the tears in her eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why are you crying? Everything's perfect.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure it is.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm pregnant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh, I'm pretty sure it doesn't happen that fast. Zoe shakes her head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I just found out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pregnant? As in you're going to have a baby? Zoe nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't understand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know.   It's hard to explain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, who's it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know who the father is. I kind of know him. I just don't know his name exactly. It was sort of anonymous.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anonymous?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's a donor. From a sperm bank.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Seriously, what the fuck are you talking about? Sperm bank? What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know, this is so fucked up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When did all of this happen?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The day we met. That same day. And I didn't tell you because I didn't think there was any way I could be pregnant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But...why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because supposedly with frozen sperm it takes a few tries and...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, why would you do this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because I wanted a baby. And I'm almost forty, and I never met the right guy. I was afraid if I waited any longer it would all pass me by, and I'd miss my chance. Stan just looks at her.       Speechless.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't know you. I would have never done it if--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I just told you I loved you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well....do you not now?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're pregnant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't say it like that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're pregnant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.   I'm pregnant.      I'm pregnant!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I tell you I'm in love with you and you tell me your pregnant with some stranger's child?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't say it like that.     You make it sound dirty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry. I...I'm stunned. I don't know what to say. What the fuck am I supposed to say?! This is great fucking news? Congratulations?! Why did you wait so long to tell me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because I'm freaking out, okay! I didn't know what to do. I made this big decision to do this and then I met you--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, what am I supposed to do now? This isn't how it was supposed to be. This isn't what--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry. I'm sorry, okay? Life isn't perfect. It's not all neat and tidy like your perfect family and your perfect farm and your bluegrass band. It's messy. It's fucked up. This is real life, okay? I'm sorry to break it to you. They both stand there.    After the raised voices, the silence feels more pronounced.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry?   What's sorry going to do? Stan walks out. Zoe stands there.     And stands there.   And then she starts to cry. INT. STAN'S BEDROOM - LATER Zoe lies in bed awake.    Nuts is beside her.    They are alone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. LITTLE GOAT FARM - DAY It's daybreak at the farm. FARM HANDS move herds of goats from one pasture to another. INT. GUEST ROOM - MORNING Stan lies awake in a small guest room.   Joan enters and is startled to find him in there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, I thought you were in your room. Sorry. (then) Everything okay? Stan doesn't answer.   Joan sits on the corner of the bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, she seems really terrific. Dad and I both think so. She's smart and poised and... Next door, we hear Zoe puking again. Joan stops.   Then, wanting to seem open-minded, continues.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And warm and gracious... Another very LOUD HURL.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And pretty and... Another HURL.    Joan looks at Stan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the hell's going on in there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's pregnant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, dear God. We hear the toilet FLUSH. INT. CAR - DAY Zoe sits in the passenger seat with the key in the ignition. Stan leans against the car. They are both quiet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know what to say. Neither does Stan, who says nothing.    He runs his foot back and forth in the gravel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I guess I'd given up on meeting someone like you, and I did what I thought was best. Stan still doesn't say anything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But, for what it's worth...I love you, too. She puts the car in gear and pulls out.    Stan watches her go. His hands in his pockets. EXT. MONA'S APARTMENT - NIGHT Zoe stands in the hallway of Mona's apartment building.   A beat later, Mona opens the door and holds out her arms.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come here. Zoe walks slowly into her embrace. They stand like this for a long time. Just holding each other. Until Mona's three kids run out with wiffle-ball bats and chase each other down the hall. A beat later, the toddler runs after them crying. INT. ZOE'S APARTMENT - DAY Zoe lies in bed with Nuts. She opens her eyes and stares at the ceiling. Then, with a sigh, she gets up and does her morning ritual. She pulls up her nightgown and sticks out her stomach.    For the first time, we actually see a little bump. INT. EXAM ROOM - DAY Zoe lies on the table with a paper gown over her lap. She looks down at her feet in the stirrups. Sadly, we notice a perfect pedicure. Dr. Harris comes in with a big smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Congratulations! What luck to get pregnant on the first try, huh? And with frozen sperm, too. So, how are we feeling?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (unconvincing) Okay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You sure about that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's been hard. I don't know if I was really prepared for this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, your hormones aren't helping, and going through this without a partner must be difficult. Dr. Harries readies the ultrasound wand and inserts the device. He turns the monitor so that Zoe can see.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, the good news is everything looks great. You are now eight weeks pregnant, which is an important milestone. With a little luck, we should be able to see a heartbeat today. On the screen we see a small flickering dot.    Dr. Harris smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's it?     That's...my baby? Saying these words out loud for the first time hits Zoe. Tears fill her eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi, Baby. (then) Is it okay? Is it healthy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everything's just... (makes a face, then) Wait, a minute...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?   Wait a minute, what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well...I see another heartbeat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (freaking out) It has two hearts?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No...but you have two babies. Zoe's mouth falls open. NT. CAROL'S APARTMENT - DAY We're back at Single Women By Choice. The women are sitting on the floor. Sara is still nursing Dakota. Zoe has her head in her hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Twins!   That's fantastic! Zoe bursts into tears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why are you crying?   That's so lucky.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yup.   That's me.   Lucky, lucky, me. The women are sensing the sarcasm, but not getting it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you okay? Is it a financial concern? There are many programs--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. I'm fairly loaded, actually. Used to work for Google. (blows nose) I'm sorry. This is hard for me. I don't know if I can talk about it yet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take your time. When you feel like sharing, we're here for you. We're all sisters here. (then, to the group) Let's give Zoe some space. When she's ready to talk, we're ready to listen. Deep, cleansing breaths, Zoe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Carol takes a deep breath and then lets it out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now, in the meantime, does anyone else have anything they want to discuss? Problems? Concerns? Tabitha, the tall woman with the nose ring, raises her hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm having a hard time. Luca keeps asking why he doesn't have a daddy, and I just don't know what--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (blurting out) There's this guy. His name is Stan. And he's fantastic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I knew it!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh...wasn't I just speaking?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I knew you were with that guy!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What guy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Zoe, this group is called Single Mother's By Choice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know.   I'm sorry--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Um, excuse me. What about Luca? He's been really, really sad.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (floodgates opening) Have you ever met a guy and you get butterflies and you think this is the kind of man who could take care of me forever? The kind of guy who makes you re-examine everything? Like, maybe I can be a stay-at-home mom and be barefoot and pregnant. The women stare blankly at Zoe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He actually lives on a farm! Plays the banjo! Maybe I could learn to sew and take care of the animals. Like Laura Ingalls. Even Dakota stops nursing and looks over at that one. EXT. CAROL'S APARTMENT - LATER The women file out. No one dares look at Zoe. It's very awkward, although Zoe seems unaware. She turns to Carol.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carol, thank you. This has been really helpful. Just getting it all out and being with other women who--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm going to have to ask you not to come back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?   Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't think we can help you, and, quite frankly, you're against everything we stand for.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But, I thought we were all sisters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.  Not you. (then) Do you know how long it took me to conceive? Five years. I had three miscarriages and spent every last dime on in-vitro. And Dana? The woman with the short hair?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Which one?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The one with the really short hair?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, that doesn't really narrow it down much.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She   just flew to Memphis to watch her   baby being born. Seconds after the   birth, the birth mother changed her   mind and refused to give it up. Zoe's face changes.     She starts to get it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So, as you can see, we are really dedicated and choosing to be single mothers, and you seem to be in a slightly different place. You're carrying two healthy babies, and you have no idea how lucky you are.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (after a beat) You're right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I like you, Zoe. We all like you. But you kind of need to figure out where you are. Zoe nods. EXT. SHADYBROOK RETIREMENT COMMUNITY - DAY Zoe and Nana are walking the loop around the courtyard. Zoe looks terrible. Like she hasn't slept in days. They complete a lap. Arthur gives them the double thumbs up sign.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That man is obsessed with my ass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know.   It's kind of upsetting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He wants to take me on a cruise so that we can finally tie the knot. But, I don't know. What's the hurry?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You've been engaged for nine years.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No reason to rush into anything. Nana looks over at Zoe.     She sees the bags under her eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You look terrible, dear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You must really love him, huh?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I guess I do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Honey, I'm sure he's wonderful, and I'm sure he loves you, too. But, you have put him in a really awkward position. Having a baby is a big adjustment for any couple. And you're not married. And he's not the father. And you've only been together a little while. And now you're having twins. And--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please stop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm just saying, if he actually wanted to stay with you right now, he'd be the greatest man in the world, and, quite frankly, I don't think any man is that great. They complete another lap around the courtyard.   Arthur smiles at them and then "raises the roof."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Arthur's just about the best man I know, and look at him. He's a fucking idiot. EXT. LITTLE GOAT FARM - DAY Stan leans against the fence looking at the goats. He has the beginnings of a beard growing. The scruff makes him look older. Thinner. Joan approaches and stands next to him for a bit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know, people thought we were crazy when we bought this farm. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All of our friends in New York, they thought we'd lost our minds. Stan nods.    We get the feeling he's heard this before.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I guess I'm saying that you may have envisioned your life going one way, but the reality is, it could go a totally different direction. You just have to be open to it. Stan watches a nearby goat coaxing her baby to nurse.      He shrugs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Having a baby with someone I barely know, someone else's baby...it's just not how I pictured it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I used to work on Wall Street. Now I wear boots covered in goat shit. This isn't how I pictured it, either. But guess what...I'm happy. She gives him a sympathetic hug and walks away. INT. STAN'S BEDROM - NIGHT Stan lies in bed looking up at the "stars." There's even less glow now than last time. He sighs and then turns over to try and sleep. ANGLE ON Nuts' off-road wheelchair in the corner of the room. Stan looks at it and can't help but smile. INT. ZOE'S APARTMENT - DAY Zoe and Nuts lie in the bed. They are looking at each other on the pillow. Zoe scratches behind his ears. Zoe goes to the mirror and does her usual. The bump is growing. For the first time, we see a smile. INT. CAROL'S APARTMENT - DAY The Single Mother's By Choice women are sitting in their usual circle. Lori is passing around a list.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Make sure you put your numbers down. I want to have everyone's number handy in case I go into labor early. Zoe enters.   All eyes turn.    She waves sheepishly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi, guys. No one knows what to say.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi, Zoe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I just wanted to apologize. I'm sorry I got into a relationship and wasn't honest with you guys, and I'm sorry I interrupted you, Tabitha. I hope Luca is doing better.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Carol) And I've thought a lot about what you said, about how lucky I am. I got into this whole situation because I wanted to have a baby. And, somehow, I lost sight of that. (then) Anyway, I need partners in this, and I hope you'll take me back. Lori smiles and hands her the piece of paper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a phone tree. I'm due next month, but my midwife thinks I may go sooner. I want everyone to be there. Are you in? Zoe smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. HUDSON STREET - DAY Zoe has her head held high and her cute belly pushed out as far as it will go. A WOMAN with a double stroller approaches.   Zoe smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi./Hi. Zoe walks on. She sees her reflection in a store window and smiles. She looks like an actual pregnant person now. As she is walking and smiling to herself, we hear a familiar voice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi. Her P.O.V. Stan appears next to her in the reflection.     For a brief second, they look like a family. Zoe turns. They both stop. Unsure of whether to hug or what. They just stand there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You said that already.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You...look great. Zoe touches her belly.    Proud but protective.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How are you feeling?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good. A long silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have a beard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, it's awful isn't it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't lie. (then) Did I tell you how pretty you look? Zoe nods.   Another silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I miss you. A group of SCHOOL KIDS, lost in their own conversations, push up the block, separating Zoe and Stan for a moment. This separation makes the moment all the more tense.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I miss you, too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This whole time we've been apart, I've been trying to figure out what it is about you that I love so much. And I think that it's that a lot of people talk about doing things, but you actually do them. You're really kind of daring. How you quit your job and took over a pet store all because some asshole sold you a lame dog. You came and found me at the Farmer's Market even though the night before I acted like a total stalker... Zoe smiles at the memory.      Stan continues.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And now you're pregnant. Because you wanted to have a baby and didn't think you could wait any longer. Well, that's just the same kind of thing. It's...brave. And I can't love you for being that way but then walk away for the same reason. Stan takes her hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I love you. I've been waiting my whole life for you. And I can't let one little baby get in the way of that. I just...can't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's something I need to tell you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's big. And you're allowed to take all of this back when I tell you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not just one baby....I'm having twins. Stan looks at her. Is she joking? Her look says no. He takes a beat. And then, even though it's not a joke, he starts to laugh. A little laugh at first and then a big one. And then, Zoe starts laughing too.   The whole thing is just so ridiculous.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is insane. INT. ZOE'S BEDROOM - NIGHT It's late. Zoe and Stan are naked in bed, lying face to face. Stan puts his hand on her stomach. He feels the little bump, new since he's last been with her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you feel any kicking?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sometimes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What does it feel like?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Like butterflies.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Stan smiles. He likes this image. He runs his hand over her belly. Zoe moves in closer. Touches his cheek.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you really sure you want to do this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.     I'm really sure. They look at each other for a long time. Finally, Zoe closes her eyes and settles in for sleep, with Stan watching her as she dozes off. INT. EXAM - ROOM CU of a MONITOR where we see two distinct baby shapes floating head-to-toe. Dr. Harris holds the ultrasound wand to her belly. Stan doesn't say anything. He looks on in total amazement.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you okay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're so...perfect.      They look like real babies.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would you like to know the sexes? They look at each other.      Zoe smiles.   Stan shrugs.   Zoe nods. Stan does, too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.     Tell us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're having two healthy little girls. Stan gets tears in his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Two girls?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Two girls.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Congratulations.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. MADISON AVENUE - DAY Stan and Zoe walk down Madison Avenue. All of the other NEW YORKERS are on some kind of mission -- shopping, rushing to meetings, or fighting for cabs. But Zoe and Stan just walk slowly hand-in-hand. Every so often looking at each other and just smiling or laughing. Then, suddenly, Stan picks her up in the middle of the street.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Two girls! A WOMAN with a BABY in a Baby Bjorn passes by.   Stan smiles. Now he's part of this exclusive club.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi. INT. UNION SQUARE CAFE - NIGHT We PAN past several small plates of food on a table.   A chef tells us what delectable items we are looking at.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here we have a yellowtail sashimi with ponzu sauce and pea shoots. This is carpaccio with shaved white truffles. And, finally, an heirloom tomato salad with fresh Buratta flown in from Italy this morning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks, Sam. It looks incredible. Sam tops off their champagne and exits.   Stan picks up his fork and starts eating. Zoe does not.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aren't you hungry?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't eat any of this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why not?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (pointing to each dish) Raw. Raw. Unpasteurized. (re: champagne) Alcohol.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let me get Sam back. He'll make you anything you want.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't want to hurt his feelings. You go ahead. I'm fine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, what are you going to eat? INT. MCDONALD'S - NIGHT The CASHIER reads back Zoe's order.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Big Mac, Quarter Pounder with cheese, four large fries, and a six piece chicken McNuggets?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Make that an eight, no, ten-piece McNuggets. (to Stan) You'll have some, right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (back to the cashier) Ten-piece. Someone will eat them. Stan stands behind Zoe with an incredulous look on his face. INT. ZOE'S BEDROOM - NIGHT Zoe and Stan lie in bed, each reading a copy of "What to Expect when You're Expecting." Zoe has the McNuggets box on her chest. She dips each nugget in three different sauces and then takes a bite. Stan watches with a mixture of amusement and revulsion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (re: book) Have you gotten to page 79 yet?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. I stopped reading when you ripped out one of my pages and used it as a napkin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Says here many women in the second trimester experience an increased sexual appetite.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Really? Zoe smiles and then slowly triple dunks another McNugget. She takes a seductive bite.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you coming on to me? It's kind of hard to tell right now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.   I'm coming on to you. Zoe throws the McNuggets on the floor and climbs on top of him. She puts his hands on her body and then starts to kiss him voraciously. After a beat, Stan stops.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have chicken in your hair. INT. EQUINOX GYM - DAY Zoe and Mona are on the elliptical machines. Zoe is going very fast, while Mona is barely going at all.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why are you even working out? This is the one time in your life you're allowed to let it go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because look at me. I just keep getting bigger and bigger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, yeah. That's kind of how it goes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm afraid I'm going to scare him away. I'm like one of those giant bouncy castles. Soon I'm going to take over the whole back yard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on.   He loves you for you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm just getting kind of freaked out by everything. He asked me to go to this wedding with him. What kind of first impression am I going to make on all of his friends?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, you're knocked up with some stranger's twins. So, already you're not exactly...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not helping.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you have anything to wear at least? INT. ZOE'S APARTMENT - NIGHT Stan, dressed in a tux, sits on Zoe's bed.    He turns to the closet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everything okay in there? A cocktail dress FLIES out and hits him in the head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Never mind. He waits a few beats.   Another dress FLIES out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This SUCKS!!!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Honey, whatever you wear is fine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't have anything to wear! That's the problem. Another dress sails through the air.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fuuuuuuck!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You always look great. I've never seen you not look great. Stan goes to the closet. Zoe is pulling on a long black dress. She tries to smush her boobs down into the top.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's perfect. You look hot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Really?    You think? Zoe turns to reveal the back.     The two sides of the zipper are ten inches apart.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you have a shawl or something? Zoe bursts into tears. EXT. PERRY STREET - LATER A cab pulls up in front of Zoe's brownstone. Stan opens the door for Zoe who is now wearing a long silver dress. While it's certainly hugging every curve and bump, it looks great.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You look smokin'.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks, honey. Zoe pauses in front of the open taxi door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's go.     We're super late. She tries to bend at the waist, but the dress is too tight. Then she tries to go in butt first and swing her legs around, but again, the dress is too tight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hmmmm...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why don't you sort of go in...head first and then turn around. Zoe leans her head in and then has no other choice but to lie down sideways on the seat. Stan tries not to laugh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shut up and push me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Push you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just do it. Stan pushes her legs, and Zoe disappears inside the cab. INT. TAXI - CONTINUOUS Zoe lies down straight across the seats like a board.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I hate everyone. She sucks in her breath and tries to sit up. As soon as she bends at the waist, we hear a horrific RIP. She bursts into tears again. INT. ZOE'S APARTMENT - LATER We PAN over the coffee table. There's a pint of melty Ben and Jerry's, a roll of cookie dough (half eaten,) US Weekly, and The National Enquirer. Zoe and Bobby lie on the floor looking at the ceiling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you think he's telling everyone why I didn't go? I'm too much of a fat-ass walrus to go to the wedding?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're not a fat ass walrus. You're pregnant. Zoe eyes well up with tears again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why are you crying? So what?   You missed a stupid wedding. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You got to have girls' night with me. This is way more fun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. I'm just so emotional lately. It's the hormones.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can't help it. Being pregnant sucks. You're emotional, and irrational, and you get back fat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have back fat?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.  I'm just kidding. (then) Okay, yes. You have back fat. Zoe feels her back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How's Stan going to stay with me through this? I'm disgusting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll go shopping tomorrow. We'll get some hip maternity clothes... whatever that means.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look at me, Bobby.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (pinching back fat) Look at me. What do you see?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I see the most amazingly wonderful person I know. Zoe smiles.   Tears come to her eyes again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: With back fat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. PUCK BUILDING - NIGHT Stan leans against the bar with a beer in hand. He is watching all of the Farmer's Market girls and his co-worker, Fred, on the dance floor. Everyone looks drunk and happy. Olivia stumbles towards him with an empty glass of champagne.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why aren't you dancing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm just about to go.    It's late.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on, one dance. The spaghetti strap of her dress falls over her shoulder. Stan notices. She steps in closer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For old time's sake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have a girlfriend, Olivia.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Never stopped you before. She tries to kiss him.    Stan steps away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's serious this time. Olivia pulls back, surprised. INT. ZOE'S BEDROOM - LATER Zoe is asleep in the bed. Her bump looks very cute under the covers. Stan quietly gets ready for bed. She turns to him, half asleep.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How was it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Boring.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good. Stan gets in bed next to her.   Zoe scoots into him.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. STAN'S ROOM - LATER They are now on their backs staring at the ceiling.    They look happy and worn out Their P.O.V. Those little glow-in-the-dark star stickers are all over the ceiling. There's barely any glow left. Stan lets out a big sigh as he looks at the "stars"...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: I miss my old ass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was one of my best features.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know what's weird?   I never knew your old ass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's kind of like this ass but way hotter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I also don't know what you really like to eat and what's just a craving, or when you start laughing hysterically and then crying and you say, this isn't me, if that's true because I don't really know the real you. All I know is the pregnant you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That is weird.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Or like how you're horny all the time? Is that you? Or is that pregnant you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (lying) That's me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When all of this is over, who will you be?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hopefully, myself again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But...who is that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. ZOE'S BEDROOM - LATER The clock by the bed says 2:30 a.m. Stan is snoring slightly. Nuts is on the pillow beside him. Zoe's side is empty. INT. ZOE'S LIVING ROOM - CONTINUOUS Zoe sits on the floor of the living room sifting through a box of photographs. We FOLLOW her back into the bedroom and onto the bed. As Stan slowly opens his eyes, she holds up a photograph. His P.O.V.    It's a picture of a woman's ass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is my old ass. Stan blinks a few times.      His eyes adjusting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why do you have a picture of your ass?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My college boyfriend took it. So, I guess in fairness, my ass doesn't look exactly like this anymore, but it's pretty close. It's held up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a nice ass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You said you don't know the real me, so I thought I'd show you. She picks up another photograph. This one is of Zoe at twelve and at her most awkward -- short hair, braces and acne.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is me in seventh grade. Stan props himself up in one elbow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You look like Anthony Michael Hall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This period, as horrible as it was, made me who I am. I think every person should go through a hideously ugly phase. It builds character. (then) It also taught me that I should never, under any circumstances, have short hair and a perm again. She picks up another picture. It's Zoe in a bathing cap and Speedo. She's holding up a yellow ribbon and has her arm around Nana.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This   is one of my favorites because look   how happy I am. I don't even know   what place yellow is, but I'm sure   it's not good.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fifth place.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But I still look super happy, right? That's all because of Nana. Whatever I did, she thought it was the best. The next picture is a Halloween shot of Bobby, Mona and Zoe. Bobby is all in green, Zoe is all in yellow and Mona is in regular clothes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: These are my best friends, Bobby and Mona. Mona and I met in high school and Bobby passed out on my couch in college and never left. You haven't met them yet because they might scare you away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why are you dressed like that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Halloween. We were supposed to be a traffic light but Mona bagged out at the last minute and so Bobby and I just look like idiots. That's typical Mona, by the way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Zoe puts the picture down and picks up another. It's a woman in a hospital bed. She's giving the thumbs up sign.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is my mom. Stan takes the picture and studies it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You look just like her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is the last picture of her that I have. She lived for a few more years, but we never took any pictures because she didn't want us to remember her like that. I was eight when she died.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...can't imagine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She had a great laugh. And really soft hands. She used to rub my back before I went to sleep. Zoe puts the picture on the bedside table, propping it up next to her clock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you have any pictures of your dad? Zoe doesn't say anything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry. If you don't want to talk about it...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My mother was in a coma for two years before the end. That's when my dad left her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So...that's when he died.    To us, anyway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: God, Zoe.    I'm so sorry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (after a beat) It's okay. It was an important lesson. That's when I realized that nothing lasts forever. This sad statement hangs in the air for a few moments.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So, that's my story. That's the real me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Things can last forever, you know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not for me they can't. Stan takes her hand, and they stay like that for a while. Just holding hands on the floor of her moonlit room. Finally, the silence is broken by the telephone RINGING.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's weird. INT. LORI'S APARTMENT BUILDING LOBBY - NIGHT Zoe and Stan enter the lobby of an old building in Tribeca.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm confused. Why did you say you would come witness this birth in the first place?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. Seemed like a good idea at the time. I was trying to get back in their good graces. Go home. I'll meet you there. I don't want them to see you anyway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's four in the morning. I'm not letting you walk home alone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fine. I'll just pop in, show my face and leave. Ten minutes, tops.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. LORI'S APARTMENT - NIGHT There are candles everywhere and a table of food and drinks. Kind of like a birthing cocktail party. Zoe eats a brownie. Carol approaches with Lori, who is wearing a caftan and rubbing her large stomach. They all hug.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Zoe, it's so nice of you to come, especially at this crazy hour.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're really one of us now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you sure you're in labor? You're so calm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, I'm sure.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I just wanted to come and say a quick hi and good luck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're not staying?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have to stay. Lori wants us all to be together for this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I really want to be here but...um, the truth is...actually I've been wanting to tell you guys for a while but, the truth is... Lori drops her head on Zoe's shoulder and lets out a giant MOAN. It's long and it's awkward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (whispering) She's having a contraction. Zoe nods.   This is weird.   Lori breathes through it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay.   What was it you were saying?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm back with Stan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stan who?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The farmer?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Actually, he makes cheese. He named a cheese after me. Isn't that romantic? Sort of? (off their blank stares) Well, anyway, I'm not technically a single mother by choice anymore. So, if you want me to leave right now, I totally understand. I'll just walk out the door and--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I really want you to stay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (bummed) Oh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Listen, Zoe, if you're happy, we're happy. We'd love to meet him. Bring him to group any time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, actually, he's downstairs, so I should probably get back to--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Great.   Invite him up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, no, no, no...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not shy. I've been through this before. It's quite beautiful, really. Zoe stands there trying to come up with another excuse. After a few moments, it's clear that she cannot. INT. LORI'S APARTMENT BUILDING LOBBY - MOMENTS LATER Stan looks up from the Hunan Lotus take-out menu he's been reading to pass the time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just a few minutes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know, Zoe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have to come up. They begged me. And truthfully, I'm kind of scared of them. Please? INT. LORI'S APARTMENT - LATER Zoe and Stan hover over the dessert table. They both eat brownies and keep their eyes down. Sara is next to them nursing Dakota.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is weird.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good brownies, though. This one has peanut butter in it. Carol walks by with a little DRUM, which she bangs rhythmically.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on everybody, it's time. She's getting into the water.

direction.raw_text: Are you okay? Out of the corner of her eye, Zoe sees an enormous strawberry on the side of the van. And then next to it, she sees Olivia.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you in labor? As soon as the contraction ends...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fuck off. Zoe takes off again.    Olivia watches her go. EXT. FARMER'S MARKET - LATER Zoe runs through the market looking for Stan. ANGLE ON Stan's truck, where Stan and Fred are unloading cheese.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stan! Fred turns around and sees Zoe running. All belly and boobs bouncing towards him. Her gown starting falling off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whoa. I've had nightmares that started like this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stan! Stan turns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Zoe?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stan!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you okay? Don't run!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't help it! She keeps running towards him. He now runs towards her. They finally meet. Zoe is out of breath and can barely talk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you all right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (panting) Great. I'm great.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why are you in a hospital gown?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm in labor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?   What the hell are you doing here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nana's my birthing partner, but she passed out and needed stitches, and Bobby asked me who I most wanted with me, and...it's you. It's only you. (then) I don't want to be alone anymore. I love you. You don't know how much I love you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Stan doesn't know what to say.   He's literally speechless.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: More than anything in the world, I love you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've been in love with you since the moment you stole my cab. Zoe bends over, holding her stomach.   A contraction.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hee-hee, hoo-hoo, it was my cab, hee-hee, hoo-hoo. The contraction ends. Zoe can finally smile again.      Stan laughs and throws his arms around her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ow.   Ow.   Ow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry. Oh, I'm sorry. I just love you. I love you so much. (then) Let's get the hell out of here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. I think I really need to go to the hospital now. They kiss again. And then pull apart and look at each other. Stan has tears in his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's go have our babies. People clap and cheer as they hurry out of the Farmer's Market. Even Olivia, watching from a distance, can't help but applaud the big moment. INT. OPERATING ROOM - DAY Some fantastic song that makes us want to cry is playing... We are CLOSE on Zoe's face. She is smiling.    She does not look scared. And she does not look alone. WIDEN to reveal Stan by her side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . And we PULL BACK and above the operating table and see Dr. Harris performing the C-section. He pulls out the babies one by one. We FOLLOW the babies as they get swaddled tight and handed back to Zoe and Stan. Zoe and Stan look at the little girls and then at each other. They are both in tears. Even Dr. Harris can't help but cry. INT. HOSPITAL ROOM - NIGHT It's night.   Zoe is asleep. She opens her eyes and takes a moment to figure out where she is. She turns to the side and finds Stan sleeping next to her, curled up against her in the tiny hospital bed. To the side of the bed are two bassinets.   Each baby sleeping soundly in a little pink hat. And in the next bed is Nana, asleep with a bandage on her forehead. EXT. 6TH AVENUE - DAY Nuts trots/rolls down the sidewalk wearing a sweater that says, "I'M A BIG BROTHER." We TILT up and see Zoe and Stan strolling arm in arm, each with a Baby Bjorn with a rosy-cheeked baby girl in it. Both girls have flaming red hair. A woman pushing a stroller passes by.   She smiles at Zoe and Stan. They smile back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi. INT. GRAY'S PAPAYA HOT DOGS - DAY They are now at the counter with hot dogs in front of them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who knew you were such a romantic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, it's the anniversary of our first date. Where else would I take you? (then) Cheers. They clink dogs and each take a bite.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What a year, huh?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Incredible. Wouldn't change a thing. Well, except for the part where you dumped me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And the part where you dumped me. (to the babies) Girls...Mommy and Daddy were stupid. The babies smile and coo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (baby-talk) Yes, we were. Yes, we were.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The first time we held hands was in here. It started out as a high- five, but then I strategically turned into a hand-hold.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How do you remember that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We both agreed that we were totally sick of weddings and hated when people wrote their own vows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's right. I remember that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So...I hope you won't hold it against me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. LORI'S LIVING ROOM - LATER Carol beats the drum faster now. Some of the other Single Mothers by Choicers join her in the chant.
dialogue.name: dialogue

result.heading: LORI GOD DAMN IT ZOE, DON'T MOVE

dialogue.raw_text: . OVER BLACK we hear silence. Blessed silence. No drums. No chants. No screams. Nothing. Until, we hear the SPLASH. INT. LORI'S LIVING ROOM - MOMENTS LATER We are CLOSE on Zoe's face.    She opens her eyes.   Blinks a few times.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . EXT. 14TH STREET - DAY 14th street is just coming to life as the FARMERS start to unload their wares. Zoe and Stan head up the street slowly, wearily, like soldiers back from battle.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : EXT. FARMER'S MARKET - MOMENTS LATER The fruits and vegetables and flowers become a blur as Zoe runs out of the Farmer's Market. Stan chases after her.
dialogue.name: dialogue
